newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico livestock report, feeder export price -USDA.
newsitem.headline: Mexico livestock report, feeder export price -USDA.

text.p: USDA reported Monday that around 2,800 head were exported into the United States at two crossing points Friday.
Through Santa Teresa, New Mexico, around 2,300 head of steer calves and yearlings were sold mostly steady.
"Trade moderate, demand good. Bulk of supply consisted of steers weighing 300-600 lbs, included in supply were 1,000 head of steers retained by owners," it said.
Prices for 300-400 lb head were 86-96 cents/lb, 400-500 lb at 76-86 cents/lb and 500-600 lb at 74-76 cents/lb.

Through Del Rio, Texas, around 500 head were sold, although not enough to give indicative trend prices. "Around 80 percent of cattle crossed consisted of corriente steers weighing 300-500 lbs," the USDA said.
((--Chris Aspin, Mexico City newsroom (525) 7289530. E-mail at chris.aspin@reuters.com))
